name: MoonLight - Saver
description:
MoonLight - Saver is one of the collaborative projects done during the one of the years studying Games Design and Art. The lead project manager was Charlie Barlow, so all creation credits go to him. All I did was apply the coding with the artwork.

I learned the coding with the 2D Platformer tutorial by Jesse Freeman on Lynda.com, now LinkedInLearning. The code was adapted to suit the necessities of the game.

Movement is done via A and D, with space for jumping and double jumping. The mouse click on certain places within the gameworld creates a line to help the player traverse a section.
